THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON

Cheers
ae eis,
2020/KER/672
Crl.M.C. No.85 of 2020 2
Cri.M.C.No.85 of 2020
ORDER

This is a proceedings instituted under Section 482 of
the Code of Criminal Procedure for quashing Annexure - A5 final
report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto now
pending as C.C.No.558 of 2019 on the files of the Court of the
Judicial Magistrate of First Class - V, Kozhikode.

2. The petitioners are accused in the said case. The
case referred to above is one instituted at the instance of the
first respondent against the petitioners under Sections 406 and
498A of the Indian Penal Code.

3. It is seen that the first respondent had settled her
disputes with the petitioners and an affidavit to that effect has
been produced as Annexure A7.

4. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners,
the learned Public Prosecutor as also the learned counsel for
the first respondent.

5. In the light of the decision of the Apex Court in

Deere

2020/KER/672
Crl.M.C. No.85 of 2020 3
Gian singh v. State of Punjab, (2012) 10 SCC 303, insofar as
the offences alleged against the accused in the case are only
offences punishable under Sections 406 and 498A of the Indian
Penal Code, | am of the view that this is an appropriate case
where this court has to invoke the jurisdiction under Section
482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure to quash the proceedings
against the petitioners.

In the result, the Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-A5
final report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto against
the petitioners pending as C.C.No.558 of 2019 on the files of
the Court of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class - V, Kozhikode
are quashed

Cri.M.C.No.85 of 2020
ORDER

This is a proceedings instituted under Section 482 of
the Code of Criminal Procedure for quashing Annexure - A5 final
report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto now
pending as C.C.No.558 of 2019 on the files of the Court of the
Judicial Magistrate of First Class - V, Kozhikode.

2. The petitioners are accused in the said case. The
case referred to above is one instituted at the instance of the
first respondent against the petitioners under Sections 406 and
498A of the Indian Penal Code.

3. It is seen that the first respondent had settled her
disputes with the petitioners and an affidavit to that effect has
been produced as Annexure A7.

4. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners,
the learned Public Prosecutor as also the learned counsel for
the first respondent.

5. In the light of the decision of the Apex Court in

Deere

2020/KER/672
Crl.M.C. No.85 of 2020 3
Gian singh v. State of Punjab, (2012) 10 SCC 303, insofar as
the offences alleged against the accused in the case are only
offences punishable under Sections 406 and 498A of the Indian
Penal Code, | am of the view that this is an appropriate case
where this court has to invoke the jurisdiction under Section
482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure to quash the proceedings
against the petitioners.

In the result, the Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-A5
final report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto against
the petitioners pending as C.C.No.558 of 2019 on the files of
the Court of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class - V, Kozhikode
are quashed.

Sd/-
P.B.SURESH KUMAR, JUDGE.
